Well, the first is that the existing middle class in rich countries will have to redefine their consumption patterns.
The second is that the emergence of a middle class in poor countries like China, India and elsewhere is going to create middle-class expectations in this country.
So, the next thing that happens after you have your three meals a day is that you are going to want better schools and hospitals for your children.
You're going to have - you want to have very stable employment for you and your family members.
And those are very difficult things for the leader - to the leader for governments.
Governments have a very hard time satisfying demand that grows very fast for health and hospital and education and jobs.
